attributes.action: Replace current ID card proposal with simple and cheap internet based ID confirmation.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Have an internet accessed database (accessible by anybody). A persons ID number would be same as National Insurance no. Typing this in would simply bring up a name, address, date of birth, and a 'recent' photo. This would be enough for most basic ID purposes. (Much better than "a recent utility bill"!) Internet access is rapidly becoming universal, including totally mobile access. For example, even foot patrol police could have internet access. Implementation involves existing proven simple technology. Individuals could upload their own details + photo. Those without access to the technology (an ever decreasing number) could hand details into a post office (an ever decreasing facility) for 'upload'.
